name: Global: Remove Inline Frames, Tables, Ads, Etc
description:
Removes Inline Frames, Tables, Ad-Bearing Divs and P-tags, and signatures that look like web bloat.
Removes Ads, Spam, and Unwanted Adult Content (esp stuff that is cross-linked)

For a good test, checkout http://www.btmon.com for a before+after (this has adult ads by the way so cover your kids/grandma's eyes first!) notice the 'after' page has no obscene material, this was my original goal as I do have two young children and hate having to shut off the monitor when unexpected ads show up on a webpage when I'm looking for my little pony episodes.. heh.
"...I'm not just the author I am also a client..."

user.about:
Gabriel Sharp

I consider myself a lifetime student of Computer Sciences and Information Sciences, as the time for learning is never over, especially when working in a field that deals with envelopes that are ever-changing, pushing endlessly, so to speak. My work and play cross paths often since I get a lot of joy out of what I do and study, some of which are:

- Perl + CPAN Developer
- Linux C++ Developer (Qt4, Qt5, KDE4, KFM5, and related)
- Shell Script Developer (Perl, BASH, sh, upstart, vim plugin development)
- Web Style Developer (CSS, SaSS, SGML, HTML5, etc) though I do know HTML4 too [who doesn't?]
- Windows C++ Developer (Old Pro in Microsoft related technologies)
- Old-School Technologies (qbasic, vbdos, borland c++, ms-dos 6.66, i386 assembler /w emphasis on _some_ 64-bit stuff)
- Music Hobbyist (Electronic Music Writer, Piano, Keyboard player/Enthusiast)
- Graphic Artist (Pencil/Pen/Watercolor physical media, Maya/Blender/3DSMax/Bryce/Gimp/Photoshop HD and post-production)

I am not currently in any group at the time. I am not sure if I will be doing that ever again. The last few groups I participated in were too incoherent and seemed to have different ideals, ethics, goals. 

I am open to suggestion or requests, just don't make them impossible for a single person to do. Requesting a theme have a black version is probably okay. Requesting that I personally show up and restyle your entire website is probably not. Of course, if I were getting paid to do it, that would be a whole other matter, but I rarely see people paying for such things these days when you can hire someone in another country to do it for 2 cents -- that's right I'm a bitter man :D= <- those are vampire teeth!!

Current Version: initial release, lets call it version 1.0
  Written by Gabriel Sharp (osirisgothra@hotmail.com)
  Updated 7/3/2011 11:06pm
  Imported CSS' From: Scratch, and from other anonymous styles that i have seen, clipped via firebug
 
  domain(s): global (all domains)
    removes: inline frames, tags that have commonly used ad-ware/spyware signatures or attributes
       adds: extra area to your webpages
      notes: intended to be used *most* of the time. I have found in my travels on the web, that
             only 1 in 100 sites did i have to disable it for, and that was for sites like Google
             that rely heavily on iframes - which is also one of the biggest ad providers on the
             web - but Google is still functional, you just don't get the background webpage view
             when previewing images which can sometimes be a blessing not only with speed but
             by not cluttering up the image.

/*
  Global: Remove Inline Tables, Frames and Ad-Bearing Divs and P-tags 
  -------------------------------------------------------------------
  Written by Gabriel Sharp (osirisgothra@hotmail.com)
  Updated 7/3/2011 11:06pm
  Imported CSS' From: Scratch, and from other anonymous styles that i have seen, clipped via firebug
 
  domain(s): global (all domains)
    removes: inline frames, tags that have commonly used ad-ware/spyware signatures or attributes
       adds: extra area to your webpages
      notes: intended to be used *most* of the time. I have found in my travels on the web, that
             only 1 in 100 sites did i have to disable it for, and that was for sites like Google
             that rely heavily on iframes - which is also one of the biggest ad providers on the
             web - but Google is still functional, you just don't get the background webpage view
             when previewing images which can sometimes be a blessing not only with speed but
             by not cluttering up the image.
     
important:  I am trying to build the best ad filtering style out there, if you have any code or
            site info (such as domain names or tag signatures) to add, please e-mail me or contact
            me via userstyles.org. (osirisgothra@hotmail.com) I will most definitely add into the
            next release.

current version: initial release, lets call it version 1.0

*/
